definition: A cardinal direction that refers to the region of the compass situated opposite to the east, commonly associated with the setting of the sun. It is frequently employed to describe a specific area or region within a larger geographical context.

examples.german: Der Westen Deutschlands ist bekannt für seine schöne Landschaft.
examples.english: The west of Germany is known for its beautiful landscape.

examples.german: Im Westen der Stadt befindet sich ein großer Park.
examples.english: There is a large park in the west of the city.

examples.german: Der Westen Europas hat eine lange Geschichte.
examples.english: The west of Europe has a long history.

examples.german: Die Sonne geht im Westen unter.
examples.english: The sun sets in the west.

examples.german: Im Westen des Landes herrscht ein mildes Klima.
examples.english: There is a mild climate in the west of the country.
